definition: to replace the current name or title of sth with a new one that reflects its true nature/rectification of names (a tenet of Confucian philosophy)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Time, then, to rehabilitate the alchemists.
sentences.chinese: 而現在時間會爲鍊金術士們正名。

sentences.english: We support HKIEd's claim to the title in the interests of teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 爲了教師培訓的前途，我們支持教院正名。

sentences.english: Hence, Jinzhong Yinchen should be the official name of this drug.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，“金鐘茵陳”應是該藥的藥用正名。

sentences.english: I hope to see Milan in the final. That would mean that they have vindicated us.
sentences.chinese: 我希望米蘭能進入決賽，他們會爲我們正名的。

sentences.english: Now an exhibition in Venice seeks to help rehabilitate them.
sentences.chinese: 目前在威尼斯有一個試圖爲這些野蠻人正名的展出。

sentences.english: Firstly it discussed the definition of documentary.

definition: to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
to avenge/vengeance
to flaunt/to advertise/to parade/boost/excessive praise
to be honest, ...
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
name/good reputation/title
(slang) (neologism derived from 背黑鍋|背黑锅[bei1 hei1 guo1]) to carry the can/to be a scapegoat
to support (a cause)
to defend/to uphold/to safeguard
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
to win an honor/to strive to win a prize
one's native country/native/local/metropolitan territory
(lit.) second spring/(fig.) falling in love for the second time/a new lease of life/rebirth
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
